config.question: Which belief of the progressives led to the establishment of commissions and agencies to oversee matters of public interest?

choices.content: Experts have the ability to solve problems.

answer_3.response: The progressives believed in experts’ ability to solve problems. At every level—local, state, and federal—thousands of commissions and agencies took form. Staffed by trained experts, they oversaw a multitude of matters from railroad rates to public health.
